result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K. Reichardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian K. Reichardt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian K. Reichardt was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Spend 12 months in the county jail w/huber privileges - Stayed.  May not have contact with Shaunta Barker or her children (including his child) without approval of agent and secondary transportation of child if permitted, no contact with her place of employment, no 3rd party contact.  Not to track victim, her phone, or her car.  Follow psychiatrist recommendations.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Review hearing 9/9/15 @ 115pm.

timeConds.notes: w/Huber privileges.  Credit for 54 days served.  STAYED.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Meier.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present and addressed.  Court imposes and stays a total sentence of 4 years WSP; 2 years initial confinement; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft placed on probation for 4 years w/conditions; 12 months conditional jail is stayed; Huber allowed; credit for 54 days served; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond from files 13CT827 and 13CT741 applied to costs.
